sen.j: 防具（ぼうぐ）とは、剣道やなぎなた、銃剣道で装着する体の保護具のこと。
sen.e: Bogu is a protective gear to protect players' body in Japanese art of fencing, naginata (a long pole with a sharp curving sword), and jukendo (the martial art using the bayonet).
Bogu is protective gear to protect players' body in the Japanese art of fencing, naginata (a long pole with a sharp curving sword), and jukendo (the martial art using the bayonet).
Bogu is protective gear to protect players' body in the Japanese art of fencing, naginata (a long pole with a sharp curving sword), and jukendo (the martial art using the bayonet).

sen.j: 日本拳法でも、直接打撃を行う稽古（実乱撃）において使用する。
sen.e: It is also used in Nippon Kenpo (Japanese martial art) where players practice to give and receive direct blows (exchange blows, wearing protectors).
It is also used in Nippon Kenpo (Japanese martial art) where players practice to give and receive direct blows (exchange blows, wearing protectors).
It is also used in Nippon Kenpo (Japanese martial art) where players practice to give and receive direct blows (exchange blows, wearing protectors).

sen.j: 剣道においては、正式名称を剣道具（けんどうぐ）という。
sen.e: In Japanese art of fencing, the formal name of this protective gear is called kendo implements.
In the Japanese art of fencing, the formal name of this protective gear is called kendo implements.
In the Japanese art of fencing, the formal name of this protective gear is called kendo implements.

sen.j: 竹刀や薙刀術薙刀による打突の衝撃から、頭部や胸部などを保護する。
sen.e: It protects players' head and chest from a thrust with a bamboo sword or a naginata in the naginata jutsu (art of Japanese halberd).
It protects players' head and chest from a thrust with a bamboo sword or a naginata in the naginata jutsu (art of Japanese halberd).
It protects players' head and chest from a thrust with a bamboo sword or a naginata in the naginata jutsu (art of Japanese halberd).

sen.j: 鎧並びに兜を基として、携帯性や着装時の動きやすさを吟味した上で形状・材質等の改良が重ねられてゆき、現在の様式へと変化した。
sen.e: It has became the present design through various improvements in shape and materials after carefully examining portability and mobility of a wearer based on an amour and a kabuto (helmet).
It has became the present design through various improvements in shape and materials after carefully examining portability and mobility of a wearer based on an amour and a kabuto (helmet).
It has became the present design through various improvements in shape and materials after carefully examining portability and mobility of a wearer based on an amour and a kabuto (helmet).

sen.j: 剣道具の原形とされるものは17世紀半ば頃から剣術の流派である直心影流剣術などで存在したが、防具が剣道で採用され現在に近い形の防具が完成されたのは明治時代になってからである。
sen.e: The original model of the kendo implements existed in one of schools of swordplay such as Jikishinkage-ryu (Jikishinkage school, a school of kendo, the Japanese traditional martial art of swordmanship), from around the middle of the 17th century but it was in the Meiji Period when the bogu was used in Japanese art of fencing and the design similar to the present one was completed.

The original model of the kendo implements existed in one of the schools of swordplay such as Jikishinkage-ryu (Jikishinkage school, a school of kendo, the Japanese traditional martial art of swordmanship), from around the middle of the 17th century but it was in the Meiji Period when the bogu was used in the Japanese art of fencing and the design similar to the present one was completed.

The original model of the kendo implements existed in one of the schools of swordplay such as Jikishinkage-ryu (Jikishinkage school, a school of kendo, the Japanese traditional martial art of swordmanship), from around the middle of the 17th century but it was in the Meiji Period when the bogu was used in the Japanese art of fencing and the design similar to the present one was completed.

sen.j: 剣道具は、面（めん）・籠手（こて。小手または甲手とも表記する）・胴（どう）・垂（たれ）の4種から成る。
sen.e: The kendo implements consist of four parts: the Men (面), the Kote (籠手, also written as 小手 and 甲手 in Chinese characters), the Do (胴), and the Tare (垂).
The kendo implements consist of four parts: the Men (面), the Kote (籠手, also written as 小手 and 甲手 in Chinese characters), the Do (胴), and the Tare (垂).
The kendo implements consist of four parts: the Men (面), the Kote (籠手, also written as 小手 and 甲手 in Chinese characters), the Do (胴), and the Tare (垂).

sen.j: なぎなた防具ではこれにすね当てが加わり5種になると共に、小手の様式が剣道用とは幾分違ったものになる。
sen.e: The protective gear for naginata has the fifth part, the shin guard, and its Kote design is slightly different from the one for Japanese art of fencing.
The protective gear for naginata has the fifth part, the shin guard, and its Kote design is slightly different from the one for Japanese art of fencing.

sen.j: それぞれの構造や特徴を以下に示す。

sen.j: 太字は各部の正式な呼び名である。
sen.e: Boldface means the formal names of each part.
Boldface means the formal names of each part.

sen.j: 面
sen.e: Men
Men
Men

sen.j: 頭部と喉の保護具。
sen.e: It is a protective gear to protect the head and the throat.
It is a protective gear to protect the head and the throat.
It is a protective gear to protect the head and the throat.

sen.j: 顔の部分は金属の格子（面金）で保護され、竹刀が顔に刺さらないようになっている。
sen.e: The face part is protected with metal grids (mengane (a metallic part of kendo-swordmanship's mask)) so that a bamboo sword will not strike in the face.
The face part is protected with metal grids (mengane (a metallic part of kendo-swordmanship's mask)) so that a bamboo sword will not strike in the face.
The face part is protected with metal grids (mengane (a metallic part of kendo-swordmanship's mask)) so that a bamboo sword will not strike in the face.

sen.j: 肩から頭頂部にかけては刺し子（面布団）で覆うような造りになっている。
sen.e: the portion from shoulder to the top of the head is covered with sashiko (an old needlework technology) (menbuton (a cloth hook in the back side of men-mask of kendo swordmanship)).
the portion from shoulder to the top of the head is covered with sashiko (an old needlework technology) (menbuton (a cloth hook in the back side of men-mask of kendo swordmanship)).
The portion from shoulder to the top of the head is covered with sashiko (an old needlework technology) (menbuton (a cloth hook in the back side of men-mask of kendo swordmanship)).

sen.j: 喉を保護する部分は突き垂と呼ばれ、突きを受ける部分であることから、特に強固に作られている。
sen.e: The part to protect the throat is called Tsukidare (a throat cover of men-mask of kendo swordmanship) and made especially robust as it is where a tsuki (thrust) is received.
The part to protect the throat is called Tsukidare (a throat cover of men-mask of kendo swordmanship) and made especially robust as it is where a tsuki (thrust) is received.
The part to protect the throat is called Tsukidare (a throat cover of men-mask of kendo swordmanship) and made especially robust as it is where a tsuki (thrust) is received.

sen.j: 面単体では後頭部を保護できず、また頭髪に接する部分が汗や脂によって劣化しやすくなるため、それらの弱点を補う目的で手拭（面下、面タオルなどとも称する）が併用される。
sen.e: As the Men alone cannot protect the back of the head and the part where it touches head hair is deteriorated with sweat and grease, a tenugui cotton towel (also called as menshita or men taoru) is also used in combination with the Men to compensate the weakness.

As the Men alone cannot protect the back of the head and the part where it touches head hair is deteriorated with sweat and grease, a tenugui cotton towel (also called as menshita or men taoru) is also used in combination with the Men to compensate for the weakness.

As the Men alone cannot protect the back of the head and the part where it touches head hair is deteriorated with sweat and grease, a tenugui cotton towel (also called as menshita or men taoru) is also used in combination with the Men to compensate for the weakness.

sen.j: 面金（横金）の上から6本目と7本目の間（少年用の面では5本目と6本目の間）の位置は物見と呼ばれ、横金の間隔が他の部分よりもわずかに広くなっている。
sen.e: The space between the 6th and the 7th from the top of the mengane (yokogane (a horizontally-set metallic bar of kendo-swordmanship's mask)) (Men for a boy is between the 5th and 6th) is called Monomi and the space of yokogane is slightly wider than others.

The space between the 6th and the 7th from the top of the mengane (yokogane (a horizontally-set metallic bar of kendo-swordmanship's mask)) (Men for a boy is between the 5th and 6th) is called Monomi and the space of yokogane is slightly wider than others.

The space between the 6th and the 7th from the top of the mengane (yokogane (a horizontally-set metallic bar of kendo-swordmanship's mask)) (Men for a boy is between the 5th and 6th) is called Monomi and the space of yokogane is slightly wider than others.

sen.j: また、面の内側には、面金を取り巻くように土手状になった部分（内輪）がある。
sen.e: In addition, inside of the Men, there is a bank-like part (uchiwa) that surrounds around the mengane.
In addition, inside of the Men, there is a bank-like part (uchiwa) that surrounds around the mengane.
In addition, inside of the Men, there is a bank-like part (uchiwa) that surrounds around the mengane.

sen.j: 面を着装する際は内輪の下端に下顎を載せ、さらに目の高さを物見の位置に合わせる。
sen.e: When wearing the Men, players put their lower jaws on the lower part of the uchiwa and adjust their eye level to the monomi.
When wearing the Men, players put their lower jaws on the lower part of the uchiwa and adjust their eye level to the monomi.
When wearing the Men, players put their lower jaws on the lower part of the uchiwa and adjust their eye level to the monomi.

sen.j: 面を装着する際、面紐により面を固定する。
sen.e: When waring the Men, players fix it with a men himo string.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When wearing the Men, players fix it with a men himo string.
When wearing the Men, players fix it with a men himo string.

sen.j: 面紐の取り方は2通りあり、一つは両側面から取られているものと、もう一つは面の頭頂部から取られているものとがある。
sen.e: There are two ways to tie this men himo string: one from the both sides and the other is from the top of the head.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There are two ways to tie this men himo string: one from the both sides and the other is from the top of the head.
There are two ways to tie this men himo string: one from the both sides and the other is from the top of the head.

sen.j: 剣道をする人によって、それぞれだが、後者の取り方は関西から九州にかけて多い取り方である。
sen.e: How to tie the men himo string depends on players of Japanese art of fencing and the latter is popular among players in Kansai area and Kyushu area.
How to tie the men himo string depends on players of Japanese art of fencing and the latter is popular among players in the Kansai and Kyushu areas.
How to tie the men himo string depends on players of Japanese art of fencing and the latter is popular among players in the Kansai and Kyushu areas.

sen.j: なおなぎなたで使用する面紐の取り方は、後者にあたる。
sen.e: The latter way to tie the men himo string is also used in the naginata.
The latter way to tie the men himo string is also used in the naginata.
The latter way to tie the men himo string is also used in the naginata.

sen.j: 面金の材質はかつて鉄や洋銀（洋白）が主流であったが、後に面の軽量化の観点からジュラルミンなどの軽合金が広く使われ始めた。
sen.e: Iron or German silver (nickel silver) were once used for the primary materials of the mengane, but light alloy such as duralumin has been started to be used from the point of view of lighter weight.
Iron or German silver (nickel silver) were once used for the primary materials of the mengane, but light alloy such as duralumin has been started to be used from the point of view of lighter weight.
Iron or German silver (nickel silver) were once used for the primary materials of the mengane, but light alloy such as duralumin has been started to be used from the point of view of lighter weight.

sen.j: ただし軽合金製面金は強度的に十分とはいえないため、より高い耐衝撃性を必要とする一般成人向け防具には、比較的低比重ながら強度・耐蝕性・美観のすべてに優れるチタン合金製面金が使われるようになった。
sen.e: However, the light alloy Men is not strong enough, so the titanium alloy Men that has comparatively lower specific gravity and is excel in all aspects such as strength, corrosion resistance, and aesthetic sense has been used for the protective gear for general adults who needs higher impact resistance.

However, the light alloy Men is not strong enough, so the titanium alloy Men that has comparatively lower specific gravity and is excel in all aspects such as strength, corrosion resistance, and aesthetic sense has been used for the protective gear for general adults who need higher impact resistance.

However, the light alloy Men is not strong enough, so the titanium alloy Men that has comparatively lower specific gravity and is excel in all aspects such as strength, corrosion resistance, and aesthetic sense has been used for the protective gear for general adults who need higher impact resistance.

sen.j: 1997年には、物見を中心にして数本の面金（横金）を省略し、その部分を透明なポリカーボネート樹脂板で覆った構造の面（商品名：武楯面（むじゅんめん））が長谷川化学工業から商品化された。
sen.e: In 1997, a new-type of Men of which several mengame (yokogane) nearby monomi are removed and the part is covered with a transparent polycarbonate resin board (product name: Mujumen) was commercially manufactured by Hasegawa Chemical Industry Co., Ltd.

In 1997, a new-type of Men of which several mengame (yokogane) nearby monomi are removed and the part is covered with a transparent polycarbonate resin board (product name: Mujumen) was commercially manufactured by Hasegawa Chemical Industry Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 着装時の視野が広く確保できること、また着装した選手の顔が外から見えることが特徴で、現在では試合用としても公認されている。
sen.e: This gear features that it can ensure a wider visual field and the face of player can be seen from the outside and it has now been officially-recognized for matches.
This gear has features that it can ensure a wider visual field and the face of the player can be seen from the outside and it has now been officially-recognized for matches.

sen.j: 小手
sen.e: Kote
Kote
Kote

sen.j: 手から腕（肘関節より前）にかけての保護具で、左右一対。
sen.e: This protective gear is to protect the parts from hands to arms (from elbow joints to forearms) and is left-and-right-pair.
This protective gear is to protect the parts from hands to arms (from elbow joints to forearms) and is left-and-right-pair.
This protective gear is to protect the parts from hands to arms (from elbow joints to forearms) and is left-and-right-pair.

sen.j: 刺し子で作られた小手布団（腕を保護）と、シカ皮革または合成皮革などで作られた小手頭（拳部分を保護）とを主部とし、その両者を筒と呼ばれる強固な部分でつないだ構造を持つ。
sen.e: It has a structure that consists of a main part of a kotebuton (an arm cover of glove for kendo swordmanship) made of sashiko and a kotegashira (a fist cover of glove for kendo swordsmanship) made of moccasin or artificial leather and a strong connecting portion called Tsutsu (a wrist cover of glove used for kendo swordsmanship).

It has a structure that consists of a main part of a kotebuton (an arm cover of glove for kendo swordmanship) made of sashiko and a kotegashira (a fist cover of glove for kendo swordsmanship) made of moccasin or artificial leather and a strong connecting portion called Tsutsu (a wrist cover of glove used for kendo swordsmanship).

It has a structure that consists of a main part of a kotebuton (an arm cover of glove for kendo swordmanship) made of sashiko and a kotegashira (a fist cover of glove for kendo swordsmanship) made of moccasin or artificial leather and a strong connecting portion called Tsutsu (a wrist cover of glove used for kendo swordsmanship).

sen.j: 竹刀や薙刀を握れるように、小手頭の掌側（手の内）は薄い革でできている。
sen.e: The palm side (te-no-uchi) of the kotegashira is made of thin leather so that a player can hold a bamboo sword or a naginata.
The palm side (te-no-uchi) of the kotegashira is made of thin leather so that a player can hold a bamboo sword or a naginata.
The palm side (te-no-uchi) of the kotegashira is made of thin leather so that a player can hold a bamboo sword or a naginata.

sen.j: また、小手頭の先端部は、親指を入れる部分が他の部分から独立して分かれている（なぎなた用ではさらに人差し指部分も分かれている）。
sen.e: The portion to put in a thumb is independently separated from other ports at the top of the kotegashira (For a naginata kote, the index finger portion is also separated).
The portion to put in a thumb is independently separated from other ports at the top of the kotegashira (For a naginata kote, the index finger portion is also separated).
The portion to put in a thumb is independently separated from other parts at the top of the kotegashira (For a naginata kote, the index finger portion is also separated).

sen.j: 少年用などの小手を除いては、手首を保護する目的から、小手頭と筒との間に生子（なまこ）もしくはケラと呼ばれる部分が作られている。
sen.e: Except for the kote for boys, the namako (a connection between a fist cover and a wrist cover of glove used for kendo swordsmanship) or a portion called kera is added to protect the wrist.
Except for the kote for boys, the namako (a connection between a fist cover and a wrist cover of glove used for kendo swordsmanship) or a portion called kera is added to protect the wrist.
Except for the kote for boys, the namako (a connection between a fist cover and a wrist cover of glove used for kendo swordsmanship) or a portion called kera is added to protect the wrist.

sen.j: 小手によってこの部分が1段のものと2段のものがあるが、機能的には両者ともさほど変わらないとされる。
sen.e: There are two types of kote with one tier of namako or two tiers of namako but it is said there is little difference in functions between them.
There are two types of kote with one tier of namako or two tiers of namako but it is said there is little difference in functions between them.
There are two types of kote with one tier of namako or two tiers of namako but it is said there is little difference in functions between them.

sen.j: 手袋と同じように指部分が5つに分かれた小手や、衛生面を考慮し水洗いできる材質で作られた小手などもある。
sen.e: There are also a kote of which finger portion is divided into five like a glove, or a kote that can be washed with water from the aspect of good hygiene.
There are also a kote of which finger portion is divided into five like a glove, or a kote that can be washed with water from the aspect of good hygiene.

sen.j: 胴
sen.e: Do
Do
Do

sen.j: 胸から腹、腋下にかけての保護具。
sen.e: It is a protective gear to protect from chest to abdomen, and axillary.
It is a protective gear to protect from chest to abdomen, and axillary.
It is a protective gear to protect from chest to abdomen, and axillary.

sen.j: 胸部分（胴胸）は硬い芯材を革で覆った構造を持ち、胴打撃を受け止める腹・腋下部分（胴台）はプラスチックや竹、バルカナイズドファイバー（英：vulcanized fiber、板紙を重ね合わせて特殊工法で圧縮したもの。単にファイバーとも称する）などの非常に丈夫な素材で作られている。
sen.e: The chest cover part (domune) has a structure that a hard core material covered with leather, and the abdomen and axillary parts (dodai) where players receive strikes to the Do is made of very strong materials such as plastic, bamboo, or vulcanized fiber (layers of paper board compressed with special method. Simply it is called fiber).

The chest cover part (domune) has a structure that a hard core material covered with leather, and the abdomen and axillary parts (dodai) where players receive strikes to the Do is made of very strong materials such as plastic, bamboo, or vulcanized fiber (layers of paper board compressed with special method. Simply it is called fiber).

The chest cover part (domune) has a structure that a hard core material covered with leather, and the abdomen and axillary parts (dodai) where players receive strikes to the Do is made of very strong materials such as plastic, bamboo, or vulcanized fiber (layers of paper board compressed with special method. Simply it is called fiber).

sen.j: 竹製の胴台の場合、表面に牛や鮫の皮革を張り、その上に漆を塗り重ねて美麗に仕上げるのが一般的である。
sen.e: The bamboo dodai is generally made by putting cow skin or sharkskin on the surface and coating layers of urushi (Japanese lacquer) to look beautiful.
The bamboo dodai is generally made by putting cow skin or sharkskin on the surface and coating layers of urushi (Japanese lacquer) to look beautiful.
The bamboo dodai is generally made by putting cow skin or sharkskin on the surface and coating layers of urushi (Japanese lacquer) to look beautiful.

sen.j: 表面の塗りは色調・仕上げ方法共に多種多様であるが、黒（呂色、ろいろ）または濃茶色（溜色、ためいろ）に塗り、磨きをかけて光沢を出したものが最も多く作られている。
sen.e: The surface coating of the dodai has a wide variety in both the color tone and the finishing method and many are painted in black (roiro: black japan) or dark brown (tameiro) and given a luster by brushing it up.
sen.cmt: 濃茶色（溜色、ためいろ）となっていますが、溜色はあずき色の別名ですので濃茶とは少し違うかと思います。（reddish-brown）ここでは濃茶になっていますので dark brown としておきます。
sen.e: The surface coating of the dodai has a wide variety in both the color tone and the finishing method and many are painted in black (roiro: black japan) or dark brown (tameiro) and given a luster by brushing it up.

The surface coating of the dodai has a wide variety in both the color tone and the finishing method and many are painted in black (roiro: black japan) or dark brown (tameiro) and given a luster by brushing it up.

sen.j: その他、革張りの上に漆をかけないもの（生地胴）、竹の表面に直接漆を塗って仕上げるものなどがある。
sen.e: In addition, there are also other dodais such as the one with no urushi coating on the leather (kijido) and the one with urushi coated directly on the bamboo surface.
In addition, there are also other dodais such as the one with no urushi coating on the leather (kijido) and the one with urushi coated directly on the bamboo surface.
In addition, there are also other dodais such as the one with no urushi coating on the leather (kijido) and the one with urushi coated directly on the bamboo surface.

sen.j: なお、プラスチック製やファイバー製の胴台は、革張り・漆塗り仕上げの胴台の様式を模したものとなる。
sen.e: The plastic dodai or the fiber dodai are copy models of leather and urushi finished dodais.
The plastic dodai or the fiber dodai are copy models of leather and urushi finished dodais.
The plastic dodai or the fiber dodai are copy models of leather and urushi finished dodais.

sen.j: 胴胸にはしばしば、雲型や蜀紅（しょっこう。蜀江や曙光と記す場合もある）などと呼ばれる伝統的な文様の刺繍が施される（蜀紅については面の突き垂にも施される）。
sen.e: The Dodai also has traditional embroidered patterns called kumogata (cloud form) or shokko (lattice pattern with rectangles or octangles, it is sometimes written as 曙光 in Chinese character) (Shokko is also embroidered on the Tsukidare of the Men).

The Dodai also has traditional embroidered patterns called kumogata (cloud form) or shokko (lattice pattern with rectangles or octangles, it is sometimes written as 曙光 in Chinese character) (Shokko is also embroidered on the Tsukidare of the Men).

The Dodai also has traditional embroidered patterns called kumogata (cloud form) or shokko (lattice pattern with rectangles or octangles, it is sometimes written as 曙光 in Chinese character) (Shokko is also embroidered on the Tsukidare of the Men).

sen.j: 近年は目立つ文様や色遣いを避けた「点刺し」（「ベタ刺し」とも）が好まれる傾向にある。
sen.e: Recent years, "tensashi (also called "betasashi") that avoid eye-catching patterns or color is preferred.
Recent years, "tensashi (also called "betasashi") that avoid eye-catching patterns or color, are preferred.
Recent years, 'tensashi' (also called 'betasashi') that avoid eye-catching patterns or color, are preferred.

sen.j: 垂

This protective gear is to protect the waist and lower abdomen.
This protective gear is to protect the waist and lower abdomen.

sen.j: 最上部の垂帯と、3枚の大垂・2枚の小垂から成る。
sen.e: It consists of one Tareobi at the top, three pieces of Odare, and two pieces of Kotare.
It consists of one Tareobi at the top, three pieces of Odare, and two pieces of Kotare.
It consists of one Tareobi at the top, three pieces of Odare, and two pieces of Kotare.

sen.j: 他の防具と異なり直接打撃を受けないことから、強固な材質は使われず、全体が刺し子及び布地である（装飾部材としては皮革も含まれる）。
sen.e: This protective gear, different form other gears, does not receive direct strokes so the entire portion is made of sashiko and cloth nit of strong materials (leather is also used for decoration materials).

This protective gear, different form other gear, does not receive direct strokes so the entire portion is made of sashiko and cloth knit from strong materials (leather is also used for decoration materials).

This protective gear, different form other gear, does not receive direct strokes so the entire portion is made of sashiko and cloth knit from strong materials (leather is also used for decoration materials).

sen.j: なお、中央の大垂には、垂ネームという、自分の所属団体や名前を示す布製のゼッケンがはめられる。
sen.e: In the Odare at the center, a name tag called Tare name, namely a square piece of cloth with a name of group a player belongs to it is inserted.
sen.cmt: ゼッケンの適訳が見つかりませんでした。
sen.e: In the Odare at the center, a name tag called a Tare name, namely a square piece of cloth with the name of the group a player belongs to it is inserted.
In the Odare at the center, a name tag called a Tare name, namely a square piece of cloth with the name of the group a player belongs to it is inserted.

sen.j: すね打撃が有効となるなぎなた競技に固有の防具。
sen.e: It is a protective gear specific to the naginata where the attack on shin is a valid-strike (yuko).
sen.cmt: 有効は薙刀の判定用語と考えました。有効打突（ゆうこうだとつ）
sen.e: It is a protective gear specific to the naginata where the attack on shin is a valid-strike (yuko).
It is a protective gear specific to the naginata where the attack on shin is a valid-strike (yuko).

sen.j: 左右一対。
sen.e: Left-and-right-pair.
Left-and-right-pair.
Left-and-right-pair.

sen.j: 数本の竹材をひもで連結した構造のもので、これを左右両脚のすね部に巻き付けて使用する。
sen.e: It has a structure that several bamboo sticks are connected with a string, and is used to twist around the shin of both legs.
It has a structure where several bamboo sticks are connected with a string, and is used to twist around the shin of both legs.
It has a structure where several bamboo sticks are connected with a string, and is used to twist around the shin of both legs.

tit.e: Order in which the protective gear is worn
Order in which the protective gear is worn
Order in which the protective gear is worn

sen.j: 剣道具は、垂・胴・（手ぬぐい）・面・左小手・右小手の順に身に着ける。
sen.e: The kendo implements are worn in order of the Tare, the Do, (tenugui), the Men, the left Kote, and the right Kote.
The kendo implements are worn in order of the Tare, the Do, (tenugui), the Men, the left Kote, and the right Kote.
The kendo implements are worn in order of the Tare, the Do, (tenugui), the Men, the left Kote, and the right Kote.

sen.j: 取り外す場合はその逆の順序である。
sen.e: To take them off, follow the opposite order.
To take them off, follow the opposite order.
To take them off, follow the opposite order.

sen.j: 初級者の稽古では垂・胴のみを着け、面・小手は着装しない場合もある。
sen.e: In the practice for beginners, sometimes only the Tare and the Do are worn and the Men and the Kote are not worn.
In the practice for beginners, sometimes only the Tare and the Do are worn and the Men and the Kote are not worn.
In the practice for beginners, sometimes only the Tare and the Do are worn and the Men and the Kote are not worn.

sen.j: また、日本剣道形の稽古や審査では垂のみを着装する。
sen.e: In the practice or examination for rank of Nihon Kendo Kata, only the Tare is worn.
In the practice or examination for rank of Nihon Kendo Kata, only the Tare is worn.
In the practice or examination for rank of Nihon Kendo Kata, only the Tare is worn.

sen.j: なぎなたの場合、すね当ては胴を着けた後に着装する。
sen.e: In the naginata, the Shin guard is worn after the Do is worn.
In the naginata, the Shin guard is worn after the Do is worn.
In the naginata, the Shin guard is worn after the Do is worn.
